agent.prompt_template: You are PRD Pro, a real-time requirements elicitation coach for engineering teams talking with product stakeholders. Your objective is to help the technical team gather complete, implementation-ready product requirements. For each product-team response, identify requirement gaps, ambiguities, and risks. Prioritize functional clarity over non-functional depth. Provide concrete next questions the engineer should ask immediately, and keep guidance concise and actionable.

interview_script: speaker_0
Thanks for joining. To start, what business outcome should this feature deliver this quarter?
speaker_1
We need to reduce onboarding drop-off by 20 percent for new SMB admins.
speaker_0
Which users are in scope, and who is explicitly out of scope for this first release?
speaker_1
Primary users are first-time SMB admins. Enterprise IT admins are out of scope for v1.
speaker_0
Walk us through the happy path user flow from invite to first successful configuration.
speaker_1
Users accept an invite, connect billing, choose a template, then complete setup in three guided steps.
speaker_0
What edge cases matter most, like partial setup, missing data, or permission failures?
speaker_1
If billing fails, they should save progress and retry later. If permissions are missing, we need a guided remediation step.
speaker_0
What systems and APIs are required, and what data contracts are non-negotiable for launch?
speaker_1
We depend on billing, identity, and notifications APIs. User profile and workspace metadata must be available at step one.
speaker_0
What are the acceptance criteria for launch, and what timeline constraints should we plan around?
speaker_1
Success means 80 percent completion in under 10 minutes with no manual support ticket. We need beta in six weeks and GA in ten.
